abstract.text: Client-side hillshading visualization based on DEM data. Currently, the implementation only supports Mapbox Terrain RGB and Mapzen Terrarium tiles.
The shading color of areas that face away from the light source.
Default value: “#000000”.
Layer to use from a vector tile source.
A protocol describing a style-related entity that can be decoded.
The shading color of areas that faces towards the light source.
Default value: “#FFFFFF”.
A protocol used to create any type of  map style content, such as layers, sources, lighting and others.

Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.
Default value: 0. Minimum value: 0. The unit of hillshadeEmissiveStrength is in intensity.
Intensity of the hillshade
Default value: 0.5. Value range: [0, 1]

uses colorTheme from the style or not.
By default it will use color defined by the root theme in the style.
Layer types that will also be removed if fallen below this clip layer.
The shading color used to accentuate rugged terrain like sharp cliffs and gorges.
Default value: “#000000”.
A style’s fog property is a global effect that improves depth perception by fading out distant objects.
Interactive, thoroughly customizable maps for iOS powered by vector tiles and Metal.

(such as on top of existing land layers, but below all labels).
